intro: Terminalia bagamoyoana, commonly known as the East African ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for construction and furniture. The tree has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, white flowers followed by capsule fruits containing winged seeds. The plant is well adapted to dry and semi-arid conditions, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
